DOC.brief_summary: This prospective study design analyse postoperative long-term outcome total laparoscopic vs. open surgical repair infra-renal abdominal aortic occlusive disease ( AOD ) infra-renal aortic aneurysmal disease ( AAA ) comparable group patient use propensity analysis model .
DOC.brief_title: Total Laparoscopic Versus Open Aortic Surgery Abdominal Aortic Disease
DOC.detailed_description: From January 2006 January 2010 , 228 consecutive patient receive aortic bypass AAA ( n=139 ) AOD ( n=89 ) study . Open repair perform in145 patient ( AAA=109 , AOD=36 ) total laparoscopic repair 83 patient ( AAA=30 , AOD=53 ) . One-to-one propensity score match study group do accord difference logit propensity score less 0.04 patient pair study group . Logistic regression help backward selection use adjust effect treatment method propensity score well variable evaluate postoperative long-term outcome . A p value < .05 consider statistically significant .
DOC.criteria: Aortic occlusive disease ( TASC C & D ) Aortic abdominal aneurysm diameter > 5 cm Patients occlusive disease amenable stenting ( TASC A & B ) Patients abdominal aortic aneurysm anatomy allow use stent graft ( EVAR ) Patients life expectancy < 3 year ASA 4 high operative risk
